Description:
Render the global header with no session. 
Ensure public-only navigation is visible and there is no flash of authenticated UI. Logo must route home; layout must be stable on desktop and mobile.
Expected Behavior: Public navigation items are visible (Home, All Events, Search, Tickets, Sign In). Auth-only items (profile, logout) are hidden. Header is keyboard navigable, with visible focus. Logo routes to homepage without full reload.
Validation Criteria: Verify presence/absence of items as specified. Tab through links to confirm order and focus. Click logo and confirm navigation to homepage with client-side routing. No console errors.
Preconditions: User is not authenticated (no Supabase session in localStorage). App is running locally.
Test Steps:
1. Clear Supabase auth storage.
2. Open the application root URL.
3. Observe the header navigation in the top bar.
4. Tab through focusable items.
Automation Location: src/lib/components/Header/__tests__/Header.test.ts
Actual Result: Automated test skipped (temporarily disabled).

Description:
Render the header with a valid session.
Authenticated controls appear without layout shift and accessibility remains intact.
Expected Behavior: User menu/avatar and logout are visible. Sign In is hidden. Header remains responsive and accessible.
Validation Criteria: Stub an authenticated session; confirm user controls appear, Sign In is absent, and logout is present. Check tab order includes new controls; no large layout shift.
Preconditions: Valid Supabase session exists in localStorage for a standard user.
Test Steps:
1. Seed a valid Supabase session.
2. Reload the application.
3. Observe the header navigation and user controls.
4. Click the Sign Out button.
Automation Location: src/lib/components/Header/__tests__/Header.test.ts
Actual Result: Automated test skipped (temporarily disabled).

Description:
Render a complete event card with title, date/time, city, min price, and image. 
Provide a primary CTA to view details/purchase.
Expected Behavior: All fields render (formatted date/price, location, image alt text). Primary CTA links to the associated detail route.
Validation Criteria: Inspect DOM for all fields. Hover/focus CTA to confirm accessible name. Check href matches event detail pattern. No text overflow beyond intended ellipsis.
Preconditions: At least one upcoming event exists with full data (title, date, location, price, image).
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to a page where EventCard is rendered (home or search).
2. Ensure event has full data.
3. Inspect card content.
4. Hover and focus the Get Tickets CTA.
Automation Location: src/lib/components/events/__tests__/EventCard.test.ts - renders the event summary with CTA for the supplied model
Actual Result: Covered by automated test; execution passed.

Description:
Render an event card where the image fails or is missing; 
degrade gracefully using a fallback or styled placeholder.
Expected Behavior: A fallback image/placeholder appears with consistent dimensions. No broken image icon. Text and CTA remain usable.
Validation Criteria: Simulate image error and verify fallback. Confirm card dimensions unchanged and CTA still works.
Preconditions: Event exists but image URL is invalid or missing. App is running in dev.
Test Steps:
1. Use an event with a broken/empty image_url.
2. Open page where the EventCard renders it.
3. Watch image loading.
4. Inspect resulting thumbnail or placeholder.
Automation Location: src/lib/components/events/__tests__/EventCard.test.ts - falls back to the placeholder image when no image is provided
Actual Result: Covered by automated test: src/lib/components/events/__tests__/EventCard.test.ts – falls back to the placeholder image when no image is provided. Execution passed.

Description:
Display a toast with title and optional message; 
it should auto-dismiss by default and be dismissible via a close button.
Expected Behavior: Toast appears in the container, auto-dismisses after duration, and closes immediately on close action. Multiple toasts stack without overlap.
Validation Criteria: Trigger toast; confirm presence and auto-dismissal within expected time. Click close and ensure removal. Verify stacking order and no focus trap.
Preconditions: Toast/notification system is implemented and wired to trigger actions (e.g. success and error).
Test Steps:
1. Trigger a success toast (e.g. after a mock action).
2. Trigger an error toast.
3. Observe toast stacking behavior.
4. Wait for auto-dismiss or manually close toasts.
Actual Result: Pending manual execution.
